pros: The head of the program was committed to making sure the kids came first. Communication and teamwork among staff was a priority which I really respected.
cons: Working with young people can be challenging.

job_title: Manager of Instruction in Washington, DC
pros: The Higher Achievement programs provide safe space and academic enrichment for middle school students. The intentions behind the programs are good.
cons: The organization did not, at the time that I was there, do a great job of investing in its in-house talent. Nearly every leadership position was filled by an outside person instead of providing upward mobility, professional development, and job satisfaction to people who were already there and doing the work. Credentials on paper should not trump the years someone has with the organization and the relationships they have with students, parents, and school leaders. There was a mass exodus of talented, passionate people because there was no clear path for growth or they were being overlooked or explicitly rejected for promotions that they absolutely deserved. People are already willing to overlook the meager salaries, but constantly being passed over for positions you know you deserve and are fully qualified for is just too much to bear.

pros: No real news here you have to work with schools
cons: Nothing bad to say about the organization

review_title: Data Driven Decision Making with Social Justice Vision
cons: Disconnect from national leadership at times

pros: Great benefits and paid time off.
cons: Leadership could do a better job of listening to staff.

pros: My co-workers were kind and understanding.
cons:
There was a lack of initiative and organization from management in oversight of all the different centers. Many times managers came to "visit" the centers at the schools - but nothing was done about how the centers were run. The lack of resources available and the lack of support was astounding. 

Fights were breaking out between students. Students rarely listened to the rules placed by Higher Achievement at the center. Often, it was me alone in a room with 25 middle school kids. 

But not once did I see or participate in a meeting that addressed these issues or brainstormed ways we could improve the environment there.

review_title: It has been a wonderful way to gain valuable professional experience, to learn the needs of inner city youth.
pros: The Scholars, although difficult at times, are absolutetly what make this position worthwhile. Once you have gained their trust and respect, it opens daily center operations to many opportunities for meaningful dialogue and emotional growth for both staff and student.
cons: Because of the current landscape of Baltimore, funding for the organization often felt thrown together which resulted in poor results on the frontlines. There is a small, and often weak, hiring pool for part-time staff amd because of failing results, school partnerships have also suffered. It is also an organization that does not promote a healthy work-life balance: if you have kids or are married, beware! It is not easy, and often resulted on arguments with my significant other after months of 10+ hour days.

review_title: Great short term opportunity, but not good in the long term.
pros: Some staffers were awesome. The mission of organization is admirable and worthwhile. You have opportunities to meet lots of different people.
cons: Communication from management was not always clear or conveyed. Expectations were exceptionally high. Mistakes fell upon those who were not management even if the mistake was not of your making. The environment at times was not always warm and inviting.  The workload is astronomically huge, although the pay is extremely low. Staff recognition feels more like a chore versus meaningful admiration. This is a good place to work coming out of college. However, not a place to stay long term.

review_title: Higher Achievement has a great company culture where people are a spirit of respect and collaboration, and they care.
pros: It's a professionally run nonprofit, which is something I cannot say about many nonprofits. The board is made up of people from various experiences and the employees themselves have a lot of heart in what they do.
cons: Resources are limited. Either bring your own software or leverage relationships to get what you need.

pros:
Company culture
Genuine love of learning fostered here - Invest in professional development of employees through trainings and biannual retreats
Flextime policy emphasizes their work/life balance focus
cons:
Sense of urgency and deadlines can be lacking
Young office which can feel immature at times
Staff with strong personalities not afraid to speak their mind - can get tiring when you keep hearing from the same people over and over

pros: They try to higher achievement like a family
cons: lack of support; magagement could have been stronger

review_title: Great Experience If You're at the Right Site
pros:
-The kids are amazing and really appreciate you being there. 
- Lots of autonomy with how you want to teach Study Session
cons:
- There's very little structure to Study Hall
- Not enough training from experienced staff
- Very low retention rate

pros: Passion of work. Culture is the foundation of everything. Truly reflective and thoughtful environment. Regular professional development opportunities.
cons: No true work-life balance. Laundry list of deliverables. Pay does not equal your role (however, it's a non profit). Meetings can be excessively long.

pros: Great community of teachers who love what they do and are passionate about helping kids.
cons: Not enough training - often summer teachers are students in or just graduated from college with no classroom management experience.

pros:
You are able to see impact that you mentoring has on the students grade.
Program provides you with teaching material.
cons: At times program seemed quite disorganized, and higher level staffed struggled to get students attention.

pros: Great place to work if you want to make a significant difference in your community! Work alongside good people who are motivated, and stand behind the mission!
Working hard to close the achievement gap and getting to know the students. Full health coverage paid by employer.
cons: Center staff hours, promotional opportunities, pay scale is low, and lack of diversity in upper management.

pros: Hire quality staff, very supportive and want to help you grow
cons: Not much room to move up
